Package projectiles

Class Projectile

java.lang.Object
projectiles.Projectile
Direct Known Subclasses:
Arrow
public abstract class Projectile extends Object
This class will provide the framework for how all Projectiles in game and the basis for how they should move. Made with similar structure to Entity abstract class.
Author:
Sean-Paul Brown

  • Constructor Details

    • Projectile

      public Projectile(float x, float y, float slope, int projType, boolean left)
      This is the constructor of the Projectile. It relies on the ProjectileConstants static class in utils.Constants
      Parameters:
      x - - the X-coordinate of the Projectile
      y - - the Y-coordinate of the Projectile
      slope - - the slope of the Projectile, what path it will follow
      projType - - the type of Projectile it is, based on ProjectileConstants
      left - - if the Arrow is moving towards the left, this should be true; if right, false

  • Method Details

    • getHitbox

      public Rectangle2D.Float getHitbox()
      A getter for the hitbox
      Returns:
      - the Player's hitbox

    • calculateHorizontalSpeed

      protected float calculateHorizontalSpeed(float slopeSpeed, float slope)
      This is a helper method to calculate the horizontal speed of a projectile for the diagonal speed to be consistent with ARROW_SPEED no matter the slope.
      This was calculated from using the pythagorean theorem (a^2 +b^2 = c^2). For Projectiles, it is (xSpeed^2 + ySpeed = slopeSpeed, where ySpeed = xSpeed*slope).
      Parameters:
      slopeSpeed - - the desired diagonal speed for the projectiles
      slope - - the slope of the projectile
      Returns:
      - the horizontal speed for the projectile to have a consistent speed
